org.openimaj.content.animation.animator

Class DoubleArrayValueAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.content.animation.animator.DoubleArrayValueAnimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueAnimator<double[]>

    public class DoubleArrayValueAnimator
extends Object
implements ValueAnimator<double[]>
    A ValueAnimator capable of producing double arrays from a set of potentially independent underlying ValueAnimators.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Construct from an array of ValueAnimators

      Construct a new DoubleArrayValueAnimator from count LinearDoubleValueAnimators with the given start and finish values, and the given duration.

                                  double... maxs)
        Construct a new DoubleArrayValueAnimator from an array of values using LinearDoubleValueAnimators with the range -max to +max and the given duration.
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration of the underlying animators
        maxs - max distance from 0 (+/-)
        Returns:
        new DoubleArrayValueAnimator

      • nextValue

        public double[] nextValue()
        Description copied from interface: ValueAnimator
        Get the next value. If the animator has finished, the continuation is checked to see if there are more animators to run. If not, then the last value is returned.
        Specified by:
        nextValue in interface ValueAnimator<double[]>
        Returns:
        the next value.

        public boolean hasFinished()
        Description copied from interface: ValueAnimator
        Has the animator finished animating the value.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if the animator has finished; false otherwise
